children.value: Some iterator helper functions have been renamed, the old naming is now deprecated.
The experimental ImageLoaders for individual formats introduced in 2.0 have been removed, use
array. This small breaking change ensures that the concept of
image types are now deprecated and replaced with
, which supports loading both a 3D tileset file and a tile. Check
Version 2.0 is a major release that consolidates functionality and APIs, and a number of deprecated functions have been removed.
All exported loader and writer objects now expose a
field. This field is not yet used by
but is available for applications (e.g. see
All (non-worker) loaders are now required to expose a
function (in addition to any more specialized
functions). This simplifies using loaders without
, which can reduce footprint in small applications.
Loaders can no longer have a
method. Remove it, and just make sure you define
now always uses the new v2 parser, and the original
Note that automatic packing of binary data (aka "packed JSON" support) was only implemented in the v1
and has thus also been removed. Experience showed that packing of binary data for
files is best handled by applications.
The foillowing top-level options are deprecated and will be removed in v2.0
No longer needs to be specied, only the new gltf parser is available.
Images are now always created when fetched
Decompress Draco compressed meshes (if DracoLoader available).
Perform additional post processing before returning data.
Auto-populated when loading from a url-equipped source
fetch is automatically available to sub-loaders.

children.value: A couple of functions have been deprecated and will be removed in v2.0. They now emit console warnings. Start replacing your use of these functions now to remove the console warnings and ensure a smooth future upgrade to v2.0.
Also, Node support now requires installing
Removal: Node support for images now requires importing
